summary: The bill, known as the LIBERATE Act, establishes a Regulatory Oversight and Review Task Force to evaluate and recommend changes to federal regulations. The Task Force, chaired by the OMB Director, will include representatives from various government offices and the private sector. It will solicit public input, analyze regulations impacting competition, business costs, permitting, and energy production, among other areas. The Task Force will issue reports to Congress and submit a special message with recommendations for regulatory repeal, subject to expedited legislative procedures.
